info.title: Starburst Enterprise API documentation
info.description: Documentation with details about endpoints and entities.

get.summary: List Starburst built-in access control access logs

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start of the log entry timestamp interval to match (inclusive)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End of the log entry timestamp interval to match (exclusive)

parameters.name: queryId
parameters.description: Query ID for which log entries should be matched

parameters.description: Query ID for which log entries should be matched

get.summary: List all data product domains
Get a data product domain by identifier

post.description: Clone an existing data product within the same domain.  All datasets are cloned as well as tags and sample queries.

get.summary: Search for data products according to the searchOptions request parameter.
get.description: This endpoint returns the first 100 data products matching the given searchOptions parameter. The number of results can be configured in the limit attribute of the searchOptions, up to a maximum of 1000.

parameters.name: searchOptions
parameters.description: An URL-encoded JSON value - see the body parameter for description of the schema

post.description: This request creates a data product in a DRAFT status. At this stage the data product's schema and datasets are not yet available to be queried in SEP. It is only available for querying after it gets published, as part of the publishing workflow.

get.summary: Get a data product by identifier
Get refresh meta data about a materialized view that belongs to a data product
Return the OpenAPI specification for the Data Product API.  Use Accept header of 'application/yaml' to request a YAML response instead of JSON.
Return all catalogs suitable to store data products

post.summary: Reassign the domain for a list of data products

put.summary: Create/Update a materialized view in data product
Create/Updates a view in a DataProducts

get.summary: Get the sample queries for a data product

put.summary: Update sample queries for a data product

delete.summary: Delete a tag from a specific data product
Delete an unused tag with a specific identifier

get.summary: List all available tags for all data products
List all tags associated with a specific data product

put.summary: Replace all tags for a specific data product with the supplied list of new tags

get.summary: Get the status of the async task to delete a data product.
get.description: Clients must poll this endpoint until the attribute isFinalStatus in the response body is true.

schema.description: The endpoint to poll in order to GET the status of the operation

404.description: No delete tasks are being processed for the data product

post.summary: Initiate an asynchronous task to delete the data product.
post.description: This workflow attempts to delete the data product's schema and its views, or materialized views, from the underlying storage system. If the deletion succeeds the data product metadata is also deleted. This endpoint returns a success response if the async task is accepted by the server. Clients must poll the endpoint returned in the location header in order to follow the status of the async operation.

parameters.name: skipTrinoDelete
parameters.description: If true, just delete from the data product DB, don't delete any tables or schemas from Trino

schema.description: The endpoint to poll in order to GET the status of the operation.

get.summary: Get the status of the async task that publishes a data product.
get.description: Clients must poll this endpoint until the attribute isFinalStatus in the response body is true.

schema.description: The endpoint to poll in order to GET the status of the operation.  If task is finished, this will return endpoint for getting the data product.

404.description: No publish tasks are being processed for the data product

post.summary: Publish the data product by initiating an asynchronous task to populate the views, or materialized views, in the schema.
post.description: The publish workflow creates the data product as a schema in the data product's catalog using the domain schema location if provided, or the catalog's default schema location. The datasets are created as views or materialized views in that schema, according to their types. If completed successfully, the data product status transitions to PUBLISHED. This endpoint returns a success response if the async task is accepted by the server. Clients must poll the endpoint returned in the location header in order to follow the status of the async operation.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If true the data product will be republished, even if it is already published, and all its datasets will be recreated

schema.description: The endpoint to poll in order to GET the status of the operation.

get.summary: Fetches all data maintenance definitions in the cluster

queryId.description: ID of the query that generated this access log

action.description: The action for which access was requested, or (ANY) if action was not specified

entityCategory.description: Category of the entity to which access was requested

entity.description: Entity to which access was requested

entitySpecified.description: If true, access was requested to a specific entity, otherwise access was requested to all entities of a given category

grantOption.description: If true, the requester has WITH GRANT OPTION grant for the given entity

AccessLogResponse.description: Details information about a single entry in the access log

nextPageToken.description: If there are more pages to the result, this contains the token used to retrieve the next page.

count.description: If provided contains data regarding the total number of entities within the result set.

queryId.description: ID of the query that made the change

entityKind.description: Kind of the entity that the change relates to

entity.description: Text representation of the entity that the change relates to

entitySpecified.description: If true, the change applies to a specific entity, otherwise the change applies to all entities of the given kind

grantOption.description: If true, GRANT OPTION applies to the affected role for the related entity

affectedRole.description: Name of the role that was affected by this change

user.description: Session user that has made this change

enabledRoles.description: Roles enabled on the session that has made this change

items.description: Roles enabled on the session that has made this change

ChangeLogResponse.description: Details information about a single entry in the change log

nextPageToken.description: If there are more pages to the result, this contains the token used to retrieve the next page.

count.description: If provided contains data regarding the total number of entities within the result set.

catalog.description: If empty it applies to all catalogs

entityKey.description: If empty it applies to all entities of the given category in the entity's catalog

id.description: Id of the column mask applied to a role.

expressionId.description: Id of the column mask expression.

forceNone.description: If true, forces not masking column values for the given entity, even if the subject is assigned to other roles with column masks to the same entity.

ColumnMaskResponse.description: Detailed data for a column mask added to a role

domainName.description: If empty it applies to all domains

dataProductName.description: If empty it applies to all data products in the entity's domain

category.description: TABLES, SCHEMA_PROPERTIES, AI_MODELS, TABLE_PROPERTIES, SYSTEM_SESSION_PROPERTIES, CATALOG_SESSION_PROPERTIES, FUNCTIONS, PROCEDURES, QUERIES, SYSTEM_INFORMATION, ROLES, USERS, DATA_PRODUCTS, AUDIT_LOGS, USER_INTERFACE, SPARK_RESOURCE_POOLS, SPARK_INSTANCE_IMAGES, SPARK_JOBS, SPARK_CONNECT_SERVERS, SPARK_UPLOADS, SPARK_SYSTEM, JUPYTER_NOTEBOOKS, S3_GOVERNANCE

allEntities.description: Is the entity representing all entities of the given category

catalog.description: If empty it applies to all catalogs

schema.description: If empty it applies to all schemas of the entity's catalog

function.description: If empty it applies to all functions of the entity's schema

GlobalEntityData.description: Data of a QUERIES, AUDIT_LOGS, SPARK_JOBS, SPARK_CONNECT_SERVERS, SPARK_UPLOADS, SPARK_SYSTEM, JUPYTER_NOTEBOOKS or S3_GOVERNANCE entity

catalog.description: If empty it applies to all catalogs

schema.description: If empty it applies to all schemas of the entity's catalog

procedure.description: If empty it applies to all procedures of the entity's schema

PropertyEntityData.description: Data of a TABLE_PROPERTIES or SCHEMA_PROPERTIES entity

catalog.description: If empty it applies to all catalogs

schema.description: If empty it applies to all schemas of the entity's catalog

table.description: If empty it applies to all tables of the entity's schema

value.description: If empty it applies to all property values

SingleKeyEntityData.description: Data of a USERS, ROLES, SYSTEM_SESSION_PROPERTIES, AI_MODELS, SPARK_RESOURCE_POOLS or SPARK_INSTANCE_IMAGES entity

entityKey.description: If empty it applies to all entities of the given category

catalog.description: If empty it applies to all catalogs

schema.description: If empty it applies to all schemas of the entity's catalog

table.description: If empty it applies to all tables of the entity's schema

tableType.description: If empty it applies to table, view and materialized view

columns.description: If empty it applies to all columns of the entity's table

items.description: If empty it applies to all columns of the entity's table

uiFeature.description: The particular UI feature; If empty it applies to all UI features

expressionId.description: Id of the column mask expression to apply in the given entity

createdBy.description: Name of the user who created this domain.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when this domain was last updated. This is initialized to createdAt.

updatedBy.description: Name of the user who last updated this domain.  This is initialized to createdBy

DataProductApiPayload.description: Data for creating or updating a data product

name.description: Name of the dataset.  Must be a valid SQL name with lowercase letters.

definitionQuery.description: Definition query for the materialized view.
definitionQuery.example: SELECT name AS region_name FROM tpch.sf1.region

additionalProperties.description: Map of definition properties for the materialized view. Valid keys are **refresh_interval**, **refresh_schedule**, **refresh_schedule_timezone**, **incremental_column**, **storage_schema** and **partitioned_by**.The list of allowed properties depends on connector in use.

definitionProperties.description: Map of definition properties for the materialized view. Valid keys are **refresh_interval**, **refresh_schedule**, **refresh_schedule_timezone**, **incremental_column**, **storage_schema** and **partitioned_by**.The list of allowed properties depends on connector in use.

columns.description: List of column definitions for the dataset.

markedForDeletion.description: Whether this dataset is marked to be deleted in the next publishing workflow

MaterializedViewDatasetPayload.description: Data for creating or updating a materialized view

name.description: Name of the dataset.  Must be a valid SQL name with lowercase letters.

definitionQuery.example: SELECT name AS region_name FROM tpch.sf1.region

columns.description: List of column definitions for the dataset.

markedForDeletion.description: Whether this dataset is marked to be deleted in the next publishing workflow

ViewDatasetPayload.description: Data for creating or updating a view dataset

incrementalColumn.description: Column used for incremental refresh to apply an incremental_column > max(incremental_column) filter when loading data incrementally from the source table. This facilitates loading only newer data from the source table instead of the entire table in each refresh iteration. If no column is specified, a full refresh is executed. The column need to be monotonically increasing with each new record. Typically types are dates or increasing integer values used as identifiers.

refreshInterval.description: Refresh interval of the materialized view.  Minimum duration is 60 minutes.

refreshSchedule.description: Cron expression for the refresh schedule of the materialized view.

refreshScheduleTimezone.description: Time zone for the refresh schedule of the materialized view.

storageSchema.description: Schema for creating materialized view storage table

estimatedNextRefreshTime.description: Estimated time for the next refresh of the materialized view.

Materialized view refresh metadata.description: Materialized view refresh metadata, such as last import status, only available for Hive catalogs

startTime.description: The start time of the import.

finishTime.description: The finish time of the import.

MaterializedViewImportMetadata.description: Materialized View import metadata, such as scheduled time, only available for Hive catalogs

connectorName.description: Name of the connector for this catalog.

isMaterializedViewEnabled.description: Whether materialized views are enabled or not for this catalog.

CatalogDetails.description: Detailed information for a catalog suitable to store data products.

dataProductIds.description: List of Data Product IDs that will be reassigned

items.description: List of Data Product IDs that will be reassigned

newDomainId.description: All Data Products specified in the ID list will be reassigned to this domain.

schemaName.description: Trino schema name that will be generated for this data product.

dataDomainId.description: ID of the domain that this data product belongs to.

summary.description: Summary description for this data product.

createdBy.description: User who created this data product.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when this data product was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when this data product was last updated.  Will be initialized to createdAt timestamp.

publishedAt.description: Timestamp of when this data product was last published.

publishedBy.description: User who published this data product.

lastQueriedAt.description: Timestamp of when this data product was last queried.

lastQueriedBy.description: Last user who used this data product.

ratingsAverage.description: Average user rating of this data product.  If empty then this data product has not been rated yet.

ratingsCount.description: Number of user ratings of this data product.

Data product summary.description: Summary data for a list of data products

searchString.description:
Returns all data products containing this string.  The following fields are searched:
Data Product: name, description, creator
Data sets: name, description
Column Descriptions: name, description, dataset name.

sortDirection.description: Specifies if sorting is ascending or descending.

limit.description: Maximum number of data products to return.  Default is 100, maximum is 1000

onlyBookmarked.description: If true return only data products bookmarked by the authorized user.

dataDomainIds.description: Restrict data products to those contained in specified domains.

items.description: Restrict data products to those contained in specified domains.

tagIds.description: Restrict data products to those with specified tags.

items.description: Restrict data products to those with specified tags.

SearchOptionsApiModel.description: Options for Data Product search.  A data product must match all specified options to be included in the results.

name.example: Select the name of all regions

description.example: This query selects the name of all regions from the tpch.sf1 schema

query.description: Text with the data product sample query

SampleQuery.description: Sample query for the data product

DataProductTag.description: Detailed data for a data product tag

DataProductTagValue.description: Request object for changing a data product tag value

workflowType.description: Type of the workflow being checked

status.description: Current status of the workflow execution

errors.description: List of errors, if any, related to the workflow execution

isFinalStatus.description: Whether the workflow task reached a final status or not

DataProductWorkflowState.description: State of a data product async workflow task execution

entityType.description: Entity type that produced the error

entityName.description: Name of the entity that produced the error

message.description: Message with details about the error

Error.description: List of errors, if any, related to the workflow execution

columnNames.description: List of column names to analyze. If empty or not provided, all columns will be analyzed

items.description: List of column names to analyze. If empty or not provided, all columns will be analyzed

AnalyzeConfig.description: Enables table analysis. Improves performance by analyzing the table and collecting statistics about your data.

dataMaintenanceDefinitions.description: List of data maintenance definitions configured for the cluster

DataMaintenance.description: Configuration for data maintenance operations. At least one maintenance operation must be specified.

cronString.description: Cron expression defining the schedule for the maintenance task

DataMaintenanceDefinition.description: Definition of a data maintenance task with its target, configuration, and schedule

catalogName.description: Name of the catalog where the maintenance operation will be performed

schemaName.description: Name of the schema within the catalog where the maintenance operation will be performed

tableNames.description: Optional set of specific table names to target. If not provided, applies to all tables in the schema

DataMaintenanceTarget.description: Target specification for data maintenance operations, defining the catalog, schema, and optionally specific tables

retentionThresholdDays.description: Number of days to retain table snapshots before expiring them

ExpireSnapshotsConfig.description: Enables snapshot expiration.Reduces storage by deleting data snapshots.

OptimizeConfig.description: Enables table compaction. Improves performance by optimizing your data file size.

retentionThresholdDays.description: Number of days to retain files before considering them for vacuum cleanup

VacuumConfig.description: Enables deleting orphaned files. Reduces storage by deleting all files in the Iceberg storage location that are older than the set threshold period. This rule includes files that are not part of a table.
